        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Note the comment in the function GetEventMessageData<span class="line"><!---->Note the comment in the function GetEventMessageData<!----></span><br>NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData<span class="line"><!---->NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData<!----></span><br><br>void NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData(Channel::Message* message,<span class="line"><!---->void NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData(Channel::Message* message,<!----></span><br>                                      void** data,<span class="line"><!---->                                      void** data,<!----></span><br>                                      size_t* num_data_bytes) {<span class="line"><!---->                                      size_t* num_data_bytes) {<!----></span><br>  // NOTE: OnChannelMessage guarantees that we never accept a Channel::Message<span class="line"><!---->  // NOTE: OnChannelMessage guarantees that we never accept a Channel::Message<!----></span><br>  // with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes.<span class="line"><!---->  // with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes.<!----></span><br>  *data = reinterpret_cast<Header*>(message->mutable_payload()) + 1;<span class="line"><!---->  *data = reinterpret_cast&lt;Header*&gt;(message-&gt;mutable_payload()) + 1;<!----></span><br>  *num_data_bytes = message->payload_size() - sizeof(Header);<span class="line"><!---->  *num_data_bytes = message-&gt;payload_size() - sizeof(Header);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>The comment says, "we never accept a Channel::Message with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes", but it's wrong,<span class="line"><!---->The comment says, "we never accept a Channel::Message with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes", but it's wrong,<!----></span><br>a BROADCAST_EVENT may contain payload with 0 size, which makes |message->payload_size() - sizeof(Header)| overflow, and |*num_data_bytes|<span class="line"><!---->a BROADCAST_EVENT may contain payload with 0 size, which makes |message-&gt;payload_size() - sizeof(Header)| overflow, and |*num_data_bytes|<!----></span><br>becomes a large value and cause heap buffer overflow in the following function<span class="line"><!---->becomes a large value and cause heap buffer overflow in the following function<!----></span><br><br>ScopedEvent Event::Deserialize(const void* buffer, size_t num_bytes) {<span class="line"><!---->ScopedEvent Event::Deserialize(const void* buffer, size_t num_bytes) {<!----></span><br>  if (num_bytes < sizeof(SerializedHeader))<span class="line"><!---->  if (num_bytes &lt; sizeof(SerializedHeader))<!----></span><br>    return nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    return nullptr;<!----></span><br><br>  const auto* header = static_cast<const SerializedHeader*>(buffer);<span class="line"><!---->  const auto* header = static_cast&lt;const SerializedHeader*&gt;(buffer);<!----></span><br>  const PortName& port_name = header->port_name;<span class="line"><!---->  const PortName&amp; port_name = header-&gt;port_name;<!----></span><br>  const size_t data_size = num_bytes - sizeof(*header);<span class="line"><!---->  const size_t data_size = num_bytes - sizeof(*header);<!----></span><br>  switch (header->type) {  ##################################buffer overflow access start from here<span class="line"><!---->  switch (header-&gt;type) {  ##################################buffer overflow access start from here<!----></span><br>    case Type::kUserMessage:<span class="line"><!---->    case Type::kUserMessage:<!----></span><br>      return UserMessageEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1, data_size);<span class="line"><!---->      return UserMessageEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1, data_size);<!----></span><br>    case Type::kPortAccepted:<span class="line"><!---->    case Type::kPortAccepted:<!----></span><br>      return PortAcceptedEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1, data_size);<span class="line"><!---->      return PortAcceptedEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1, data_size);<!----></span><br>    case Type::kObserveProxy:<span class="line"><!---->    case Type::kObserveProxy:<!----></span><br>      return ObserveProxyEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1, data_size);<span class="line"><!---->      return ObserveProxyEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1, data_size);<!----></span><br>    case Type::kObserveProxyAck:<span class="line"><!---->    case Type::kObserveProxyAck:<!----></span><br>      return ObserveProxyAckEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1,<span class="line"><!---->      return ObserveProxyAckEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1,<!----></span><br>                                               data_size);<span class="line"><!---->                                               data_size);<!----></span><br>    case Type::kObserveClosure:<span class="line"><!---->    case Type::kObserveClosure:<!----></span><br>      return ObserveClosureEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1, data_size);<span class="line"><!---->      return ObserveClosureEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1, data_size);<!----></span><br>    case Type::kMergePort:<span class="line"><!---->    case Type::kMergePort:<!----></span><br>      return MergePortEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1, data_size);<span class="line"><!---->      return MergePortEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1, data_size);<!----></span><br>    case Type::kUserMessageReadAckRequest:<span class="line"><!---->    case Type::kUserMessageReadAckRequest:<!----></span><br>      return UserMessageReadAckRequestEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1,<span class="line"><!---->      return UserMessageReadAckRequestEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1,<!----></span><br>                                                         data_size);<span class="line"><!---->                                                         data_size);<!----></span><br>    case Type::kUserMessageReadAck:<span class="line"><!---->    case Type::kUserMessageReadAck:<!----></span><br>      return UserMessageReadAckEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1,<span class="line"><!---->      return UserMessageReadAckEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1,<!----></span><br>                                                  data_size);<span class="line"><!---->                                                  data_size);<!----></span><br>    default:<span class="line"><!---->    default:<!----></span><br>      DVLOG(2) << "Ingoring unknown port event type: "<span class="line"><!---->      DVLOG(2) &lt;&lt; "Ingoring unknown port event type: "<!----></span><br>               << static_cast<uint32_t>(header->type);<span class="line"><!---->               &lt;&lt; static_cast&lt;uint32_t&gt;(header-&gt;type);<!----></span><br>      return nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->      return nullptr;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>To reproduce the issue, please patch chrome through the following patch<span class="line"><!---->To reproduce the issue, please patch chrome through the following patch<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/mojo/core/node_channel.cc b/mojo/core/node_channel.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/mojo/core/node_channel.cc b/mojo/core/node_channel.cc<!----></span><br>index c48fb573fea9..7ce197a579f5 100644<span class="line"><!---->index c48fb573fea9..7ce197a579f5 100644<!----></span><br>--- a/mojo/core/node_channel.cc<span class="line"><!---->--- a/mojo/core/node_channel.cc<!----></span><br>+++ b/mojo/core/node_channel.cc<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/mojo/core/node_channel.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -17,7 +17,7 @@<span class="line"><!---->@@ -17,7 +17,7 @@<!----></span><br> #include "mojo/core/configuration.h"<span class="line"><!----> #include "mojo/core/configuration.h"<!----></span><br> #include "mojo/core/core.h"<span class="line"><!----> #include "mojo/core/core.h"<!----></span><br> #include "mojo/core/request_context.h"<span class="line"><!----> #include "mojo/core/request_context.h"<!----></span><br>-<span class="line"><!---->-<!----></span><br>+#include "base/trace_event/trace_event.h"<span class="line"><!---->+#include "base/trace_event/trace_event.h"<!----></span><br> namespace mojo {<span class="line"><!----> namespace mojo {<!----></span><br> namespace core {<span class="line"><!----> namespace core {<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>@@ -327,12 +327,23 @@ void NodeChannel::AcceptInvitee(const ports::NodeName& inviter_name,<span class="line"><!---->@@ -327,12 +327,23 @@ void NodeChannel::AcceptInvitee(const ports::NodeName&amp; inviter_name,<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br> void NodeChannel::AcceptInvitation(const ports::NodeName& token,<span class="line"><!----> void NodeChannel::AcceptInvitation(const ports::NodeName&amp; token,<!----></span><br>                                    const ports::NodeName& invitee_name) {<span class="line"><!----> =<!----></span><br>+        CreateMessage(MessageType::BROADCAST_EVENT, 16, 0, &data);<span class="line"><!---->+        CreateMessage(MessageType::BROADCAST_EVENT, 16, 0,         This bug requires manual review: We are only 4 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 4 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative?       </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -reward-topanel reward-unpaid reward-20000
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -reward-topanel reward-unpaid reward-20000

        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

            Issue 1195308: Security: Integer Overflow leads to heap buffer overflow in the function 
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1195308: Security: Integer Overflow leads to heap buffer overflow in the function 
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      higon...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/749006040" title="higon...@gmail.com"><!---->higon...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      higon...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->higon...@gmail.com<!----></span>

      Note the comment in the function GetEventMessageData<span class="line"><!---->Note the comment in the function GetEventMessageData<!----></span><br>NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData<span class="line"><!---->NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData<!----></span><br><br>void NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData(Channel::Message* message,<span class="line"><!---->void NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData(Channel::Message* message,<!----></span><br>                                      void** data,<span class="line"><!---->                                      void** data,<!----></span><br>                                      size_t* num_data_bytes) {<span class="line"><!---->                                      size_t* num_data_bytes) {<!----></span><br>  // NOTE: OnChannelMessage guarantees that we never accept a Channel::Message<span class="line"><!---->  // NOTE: OnChannelMessage guarantees that we never accept a Channel::Message<!----></span><br>  // with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes.<span class="line"><!---->  // with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes.<!----></span><br>  *data = reinterpret_cast<Header*>(message->mutable_payload()) + 1;<span class="line"><!---->  *data = reinterpret_cast&lt;Header*&gt;(message-&gt;mutable_payload()) + 1;<!----></span><br>  *num_data_bytes = message->payload_size() - sizeof(Header);<span class="line"><!---->  *num_data_bytes = message-&gt;payload_size() - sizeof(Header);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>The comment says, "we never accept a Channel::Message with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes", but it's wrong,<span class="line"><!---->The comment says, "we never accept a Channel::Message with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes", but it's wrong,<!----></span><br>a BROADCAST_EVENT may contain payload with 0 size, which makes |message->payload_size() - sizeof(Header)| overflow, and |*num_data_bytes|<span class="line"><!---->a BROADCAST_EVENT may contain payload with 0 size, which makes |message-&gt;payload_size() - sizeof(Header)| overflow, and |*num_data_bytes|<!----></span><br>becomes a large value and cause heap buffer overflow in the following function<span class="line"><!---->becomes a large value and cause heap buffer overflow in the following function<!----></span><br><br>ScopedEvent Event::Deserialize(const void* buffer, size_t num_bytes) {<span class="line"><!---->ScopedEvent Event::Deserialize(const void* buffer, size_t num_bytes) {<!----></span><br>  if (num_bytes < sizeof(SerializedHeader))<span class="line"><!---->  if (num_bytes &lt; sizeof(SerializedHeader))<!----></span><br>    return header-&gt;port_name;<!----></span><br>  const size_t data_size = num_bytes - sizeof(*header);<span class="line"><!---->  const size_t data_size = num_bytes - sizeof(*header);<!----></span><br> I'll have to defer to a Mojo owner for whether a compromised renderer could really send such a message, but I've triaged assuming it's possible.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report!         This bug requires manual review: We are only 4 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 4 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: govind@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), cindyb@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: govind@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), cindyb@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1195308: Security: Integer Overflow leads to heap buffer overflow in the function 
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1195308: Security: Integer Overflow leads to heap buffer overflow in the function 
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      higon...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/749006040" title="higon...@gmail.com"><!---->higon...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      higon...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->higon...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Fri, Apr 2, 2021, 4:22 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Apr 2, 2021, 4:22 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">

            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Apr 2, 2021, 4:22 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1195308: Security: Integer Overflow leads to heap buffer overflow in the function

      Note the comment in the function GetEventMessageData<span class="line"><!---->Note the comment in the function GetEventMessageData<!----></span><br>NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData<span class="line"><!---->NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData<!----></span><br><br>void NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData(Channel::Message* message,<span class="line"><!---->void NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData(Channel::Message* message,<!----></span><br>                                      void** data,<span class="line"><!---->                                      void** data,<!----></span><br>                                      size_t* num_data_bytes) {<span class="line"><!---->                                      size_t* num_data_bytes) {<!----></span><br>  // NOTE: OnChannelMessage guarantees that we never accept a Channel::Message<span class="line"><!---->  // NOTE: OnChannelMessage guarantees that we never accept a Channel::Message<!----></span><br>  // with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes.<span class="line"><!---->  // with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes.<!----></span><br>  *data = reinterpret_cast<Header*>(message->mutable_payload()) + 1;<span class="line"><!---->  *data = reinterpret_cast&lt;Header*&gt;(message-&gt;mutable_payload()) + 1;<!----></span><br>  *num_data_bytes = message->payload_size() - sizeof(Header);<span class="line"><!---->  *num_data_bytes = message-&gt;payload_size() - sizeof(Header);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>The comment says, "we never accept a Channel::Message with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes", but it's wrong,<span class="line"><!---->The comment says, "we never accept a Channel::Message with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes", but it's wrong,<!----></span><br>a BROADCAST_EVENT may contain payload with 0 size, which makes |message->payload_size() - sizeof(Header)| overflow, and |*num_data_bytes|<span class="line"><!---->a BROADCAST_EVENT may contain payload with 0 size, which makes |message-&gt;payload_size() - sizeof(Header)| overflow, and |*num_data_bytes|<!----></span><br>becomes a large value and cause heap buffer overflow in the following function<span class="line"><!---->becomes a large value and cause heap buffer overflow in the following function<!----></span><br><br>ScopedEvent Event::Deserialize(const void* buffer, size_t num_bytes) {<span class="line"><!---->ScopedEvent Event::Deserialize(const void* buffer, size_t num_bytes) {<!----></span><br>  if (num_bytes < sizeof(SerializedHeader))<span class="line"><!---->  if (num_bytes &lt; sizeof(SerializedHeader))<!----></span><br>    return nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    return nullptr;<!----></span><br><br>  const auto* header = static_cast<const SerializedHeader*>(buffer);<span class="line"><!---->  const auto* header = static_cast&lt;const SerializedHeader*&gt;(buffer);<!----></span><br>  const PortName& port_name = header->port_name;<span class="line"><!---->  const PortName&amp; port_name = header-&gt;port_name;<!----></span><br>  const size_t data_size = num_bytes - sizeof(*header);<span class="line"><!---->  const size_t data_size = num_bytes - sizeof(*header);<!----></span><br>  switch (header->type) {  ##################################buffer overflow access start from here<span class="line"><!---->  switch (header-&gt;type) {  ##################################buffer overflow access start from here<!----></span><br>    case Type::kUserMessage:<span class="line"><!---->    case Type::kUserMessage:<!----></span><br>      return UserMessageEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1, data_size);<span class="line"><!---->      return UserMessageEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1, data_size);<!----></span><br>    case return ObserveProxyEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1, data_size);<span class="line"><!---->      return ObserveProxyEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1, data_size);<!----></span><br>     return ObserveProxyAckEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1,<!----></span><br>                                               data_size);<span class="line"><!----> MergePortEvent::Deserialize(port_name, header + 1, data_size);<!----></span><br>    case Type::kUserMessageReadAckRequest:<span class="line"><!---->    case << static_cast<uint32_t>(header->type);<span class="line"><!---->               &lt;&lt; static_cast&lt;uint32_t&gt;(header-&gt;type);<!----></span><br>      return nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by higon...@gmail.com (Apr 2, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by higon...@gmail.com (Apr 2, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by higon...@gmail.com (Apr 2, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by higon...@gmail.com (Apr 2, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      Note the comment in the function GetEventMessageData<span class="line"><!---->Note the comment in the function GetEventMessageData<!----></span><br>NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData<span class="line"><!---->NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData<!----></span><br><br>void NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData(Channel::Message* message,<span class="line"><!---->void NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData(Channel::Message* message,<!----></span><br>                                      void** data,<span class="line"><!---->                                      void** data,<!----></span><br>                                      size_t* num_data_bytes) {<span class="line"><!---->                                      size_t* num_data_bytes) {<!----></span><br>  // NOTE: OnChannelMessage guarantees that we never accept a Channel::Message<span class="line"><!---->  // NOTE: OnChannelMessage guarantees that we never accept a Channel::Message<!----></span><br>  // with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes.<span class="line"><!---->  // with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes.<!----></span><br>  *data = reinterpret_cast<Header*>(message->mutable_payload()) + 1;<span class="line"><!---->  *data = reinterpret_cast&lt;Header*&gt;(message-&gt;mutable_payload()) + 1;<!----></span><br>  *num_data_bytes = message->payload_size() - sizeof(Header);<span class="line"><!---->  *num_data_bytes = message-&gt;payload_size() - sizeof(Header);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>The comment says, "we never accept a Channel::Message with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes", but it's wrong,<span class="line"><!---->The comment says, "we never accept a Channel::Message with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes", but it's wrong,<!----></span><br>a BROADCAST_EVENT may contain payload with 0 size, which makes |message->payload_size() - sizeof(Header)| overflow, and |*num_data_bytes|<span class="line"><!---->a BROADCAST_EVENT may contain payload with 0 size, which makes |message-&gt;payload_size() - sizeof(Header)| overflow, and |*num_data_bytes|<!----></span><br>becomes a large value and cause heap buffer overflow in the following function<span class="line"><!---->becomes a large value and cause heap buffer overflow in the following function<!----></span><br><br>ScopedEvent Event::Deserialize(const void* buffer, size_t num_bytes) {<span class="line"><!---->ScopedEvent Event::Deserialize(const         This bug requires manual review: We are only 4 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 4 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: govind@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), cindyb@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: govind@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), cindyb@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>
    <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {

      Note the comment in the function GetEventMessageData<span class="line"><!---->Note the comment in the function GetEventMessageData<!----></span><br>NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData<span class="line"><!---->NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData<!----></span><br><br>void NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData(Channel::Message* message,<span class="line"><!---->void NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData(Channel::Message* message,<!----></span><br>                                      void** data,<span class="line"><!---->                                      void** data,<!----></span><br>                                      size_t* num_data_bytes) {<span class="line"><!---->                                      size_t* num_data_bytes) {<!----></span><br>  // NOTE: OnChannelMessage guarantees that we never accept a Channel::Message<span class="line"><!---->  // NOTE: OnChannelMessage guarantees that we never accept a Channel::Message<!----></span><br>  // with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes.<span class="line"><!---->  // with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes.<!----></span><br>  *data = reinterpret_cast<Header*>(message->mutable_payload()) + 1;<span class="line"><!---->  *data = reinterpret_cast&lt;Header*&gt;(message-&gt;mutable_payload()) + 1;<!----></span><br>  *num_data_bytes = message->payload_size() - sizeof(Header);<span class="line"><!---->  *num_data_bytes = message-&gt;payload_size() - sizeof(Header);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>The comment says, "we never accept a Channel::Message with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes", but it's wrong,<span class="line"><!---->The comment says, "we never accept a Channel::Message with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes", but it's wrong,<!----></span><br>a BROADCAST_EVENT may contain payload with 0 size, which makes |message->payload_size() - sizeof(Header)| overflow, and |*num_data_bytes|<span class="line"><!---->a BROADCAST_EVENT may contain payload with 0 size, which makes |message-&gt;payload_size() - sizeof(Header)| overflow, and |*num_data_bytes|<!----></span><br>becomes a large value and cause heap buffer overflow in the following function<span class="line"><!---->becomes a large value and cause heap buffer overflow in the following function<!----></span><br><br>ScopedEvent Event::Deserialize(const void* buffer, size_t num_bytes) {<span class="line"><!---->ScopedEvent Event::Deserialize(const header-&gt;port_name;<!----></span><br>  const size_t data_size = num_bytes - sizeof(*header);<span class="line"><!---->  const size_t data_size = num_bytes - sizeof(*header);<!----></span><br> Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      Note the comment in the function GetEventMessageData<span class="line"><!---->Note the comment in the function GetEventMessageData<!----></span><br>NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData<span class="line"><!---->NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData<!----></span><br><br>void NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData(Channel::Message* message,<span class="line"><!---->void NodeChannel::GetEventMessageData(Channel::Message* message,<!----></span><br>                                      void** data,<span class="line"><!---->                                      void** data,<!----></span><br>                                      size_t* num_data_bytes) {<span class="line"><!---->                                      size_t* num_data_bytes) {<!----></span><br>  // NOTE: OnChannelMessage guarantees that we never accept a Channel::Message<span class="line"><!---->  // NOTE: OnChannelMessage guarantees that we never accept a Channel::Message<!----></span><br>  // with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes.<span class="line"><!---->  // with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes.<!----></span><br>  *data = reinterpret_cast<Header*>(message->mutable_payload()) + 1;<span class="line"><!---->  *data = reinterpret_cast&lt;Header*&gt;(message-&gt;mutable_payload()) + 1;<!----></span><br>  *num_data_bytes = message->payload_size() - sizeof(Header);<span class="line"><!---->  *num_data_bytes = message-&gt;payload_size() - sizeof(Header);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>The comment says, "we never accept a Channel::Message with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes", but it's wrong,<span class="line"><!---->The comment says, "we never accept a Channel::Message with a payload of fewer than |sizeof(Header)| bytes", but it's wrong,<!----></span><br>a BROADCAST_EVENT may contain payload with 0 size, which makes |message->payload_size() - sizeof(Header)| overflow, and |*num_data_bytes|<span class="line"><!---->a BROADCAST_EVENT may contain payload with 0 size, which makes |message-&gt;payload_size() - sizeof(Header)| overflow, and |*num_data_bytes|<!----></span><br>becomes a large value and cause heap buffer overflow in the following function<span class="line"><!---->becomes a large value and cause heap buffer overflow in the following function<!----></span><br><br>ScopedEvent Event::Deserialize(const void* buffer, size_t num_bytes) {<span class="line"><!---->ScopedEvent Event::Deserialize(const void* buffer, size_t num_bytes) {<!----></span><br>  if (num_bytes < sizeof(SerializedHeader))<span class="line"><!---->  if (num_bytes &lt; sizeof(SerializedHeader))<!----></span><br>    return nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    return nullptr;<!----></span><br><br>  const auto* header = static_cast<const SerializedHeader*>(buffer);<span class="line"><!---->  const auto* header = static_cast&lt;const SerializedHeader*&gt;(buffer);<!----></span><br>  const PortName& port_name = header->port_name;<span class="line"><!---->  const PortName&amp; port_name = header-&gt;port_name;<!----></span><br>  const size_t data_size = num_bytes - sizeof(*header);<span class="line"><!---->  const size_t data_size = num_bytes - sizeof(*header);<!----></span><br>  switch (header->type) {  ##################################buffer overflow access start from here<span class="line"><!---->  switch (header-&gt;type) {  ##################################buffer overflow access start from here<!----></span><br>    case Type::kUserMessage:<span class="line"><!---->    case Type::kUserMessage:<!----></span><br>      return         This bug requires manual review: We are only 4 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 4 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;

          padding: 0;

          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */

          position: relative;
        }

        for LitElement.

window.prpcClient = new AutoRefreshPrpcClient(
 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
